The clips feed can be accessed at different levels: the content is then filtered depending on the level, but the structure is identical.When accessed: from the top, the feed contains all the clips for the brand;  at series level, the feed contains only clips from the series; and  at episode level, the feed contains only clips for the episode (and is very unlikely to require pagination). The entries for the Clips Landing Feed contain references to each short-form asset.

http://api.channel4.com/pmlsd/brand-web-safe-title/videos/series-series_number.atom?apikey=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

http://api.channel4.com/pmlsd/peep-show/videos.atom?apikey=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve clips for a specific series
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves an Atom feed containing metadata for short-form video clips filtered to a specific series. Returns clip entries with references to each short-form asset within the series. Requires brand web-safe title and series number as path parameters. Use this to access clips scoped to a particular series within a brand.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks specificity about series-level scope and uses generic naming convention. Description mixes multiple access levels when this endpoint is series-specific. Clarified the action, specified series-level filtering, and made the scope distinction clear for AI agents to differentiate from brand-level and episode-level endpoints.
